data.description:
Given Psi Aeterna IV is a special ammo weapon, we want to maximise the Handling, so Quick Launch and a Handling masterwork are ideal. Appended Mag is our magazine of choice because it offers some auto-reloading features and is the best magazine without any negative trade-offs.

For perks, we recommend Trickle Charge as it allows you to continuously fire the weapon in DPS scenarios where this weapon will likely truly shine. However, if you want something more general, Blast Disruptor is a very suitable alternative. For perk 2, again, focusing on DPS, Elemental Honing is by far the best option. This perk will also simply activate in moment-to-moment gameplay, boosting your damage by a solid amount, particularly if you are on Prismatic. However, if you would rather lean further into Arc, Jolting Feedback is a great alternative.
data.name: Blueberries

data.description:
On Mistral Lift, we first take Fluted Barrel as it boosts the Handling and Stability of the weapon, making it easier to use. For the magazine, you can go with either Liquid Coils or Accelerated Coils. The latter will do slightly more damage per second, but Liquid Coils will be more damage overall, however, the actual damage difference between both options is very low. Charge Time is the best masterwork available.

For perks, we suggest Envious Arsenal in the first column as it is an excellent reload perk, however, Reconstruction is an okay backup. Bait and Switch is the go-to for perk 2 as it is the best damage perk available on Mistral Lift, but Precision Instrument is a reasonable backup option.
data.name: Blueberries

data.description: First and foremost, we’ll need to address that high heat-generating stat. Being at a base of 90 means it doesn’t take long to reach the max, so Ionized Heatsink and a Heat Generation Masterwork should knock it down to a more comfortable 60. And as always, Fluted Barrel provides the overall QoL.\n\nPerk 1 has no real competition thanks to Destabilizing Rounds appearing in this column instead of Perk 2, but Cooling Baubles is a solid alternative for dealing with heat buildup. Speaking of Perk 2, you’ll find far more choices here, but we believe Thermal Atomization or Desperate Measures are your best choices to make this weapon the best it can be, especially with the high heat stat making TA up almost always.
data.name: Blueberries

data.description: With how low the range is on this weapon, it’s not worth going for solely range-boosting barrels and batteries, so it’s best to spread it out amongst the lesser stats, which, thankfully, here are just range and stability. Smallbore, Particle Repeater, and a Range masterwork are all you need to get your stats in the right place.\n\nAs for your perks, Perk 1 has the granddaddy of range boosters: Rangefinder. Now granting +10 range on ADS, you’re hitting even farther than before! Delicate Tuning gets an honorable mention, but as it decays in effectiveness as you reach 50% heat, it’s not worth it unless you really pace those shots. Perk 2 has a good variety of damage boosters, but Kill Clip or Desperate Measure are arguably your best choices given the current sandbox. Precision Instrument is also a good choice, though its effectiveness in PvP varies widely.
data.name: Blueberries

data.description: Fimbulwinter Stitch starts with some stats on the lower end, so using the combination of Fluted Barrel and Appended Mag helps raise Handling and increases Magazine size to a good level. Sidearms are naturally good for fast bursts of damage or quick swaps, so the Handling benefits most here with the main perk of Supercharged Magazine helping feed ammo back to the gun and enhancing the base low Reload Speed.\n\nThe main perks focus on Arc potential, and this starts with Supercharged Magazine, which benefits from being Amplified, and Speed Booster, which refills the Magazine and also overflows it to over maximum capacity. This feeds Jolting Feedback perfectly as sustained damage applies Jolt. Doing this while Amplified applies Jolt in fewer shots. This chain lightning effect will damage the main target and chain to surrounding enemies. This powerful combination gets the job done across all tiers of PvE difficulty.
data.name: Blueberries

data.description:
Precision Frame Sidearms can do a solid job in The Crucible, and this god roll of Fimbulwinter Stitch is the best of the current crop.

Start with Smallbore and Ricochet Rounds for boosts to the essential stats in Range and Stability, as well as providing bullets with the ability to ricochet off hard surfaces. These stats ensure this weapon feels responsive when targeting Guardians at longer distances and is easy to keep on target whilst in a gunfight.

We then go to Rangefinder for its boost to Range and accuracy, ensuring this weapon remains lethal even outside of its effective range. Sign off with Precision Instrument, which rewards an accurate trigger finger with a stacking damage increase of up to 25 percent as long as no shots are missed and the weapon is not reloaded. Kill Clip is also a solid alternative here if you’d prefer the guaranteed buff of 25 percent after a kill and reload.
data.name: Blueberries

data.description:
M-17 “Fast Talker“ joins great company when it comes to PvP for weapons in this archetype, and this god roll can definitely compete with some of the old reliables, such as the Multimach CCX. 

Firstly, we look to give M-17 “Fast Talker“ as much Range as possible, so pair up Hammer-Forged Rifling with Projection Fuse for a big +20 with a further +10 by adding in the Range Masterwork. This ensures a highly accurate weapon at distance, which is further enhanced by the first main perk, Delicate Tuning. This new perk adds boosts to Range, Handling, and Accuracy, which are all essential to getting the edge in a gunfight. 

Finish off with Target Lock, which rewards an accurate hand with an increased damage bonus as long as shots remain on target. Doing so gives the wielder a huge advantage going into any Crucible arena.
data.name: Blueberries

data.description:
The M-17 “Fast Talker“ is a great addition to 900 RPM Submachine Guns, and this PvE god roll carries plenty to enjoy.

Start with Fluted Barrel and Lightsink to give a much-needed boost to Handling, helping the weapon feel much smoother when readying up. Paired with the Masterwork this can reach 100 Handling, which is a nice bonus. 

The main perk set is a combination of Attrition Orbs and Master of Arms. Attrition Orbs has flown up the ranks to become a top-tier perk in recent times, with sustained damage creating an Orb of Power. The fast-firing M-17 “Fast Talker“ will have no problem taking advantage of this perk. This can be essential to enhancing builds and damage increases via armor charges. Master of Arms then finishes this weapon off for added damage upon defeating targets, reaching a maximum of 25% when at 2 stacks.
data.name: Blueberries

data.description:
Uncivil Discourse is an excellent entry into this new weapon type. Hits hard with a generous magazine size, this weapon will do the work in all levels of content.

We will start by saying that for Hunters, the combination of Lucky Pants, Precision Instrument, and the Holofoil origin trait, Accelerated Assault, produces incredible damage numbers. Currently one of the most chased rolls out there, and while it will still do serious damage to other classes, this is one of the more exciting DPS options currently in-game.

Start with Fluted Barrel and Ionized Heatsink, which pushes Handling to near max for a light and snappy feel when switching to this weapon, and the Battery will reduce heat generated, allowing more shots to be fired before an overheat.

For the main perks, Air Trigger fits nicely in the first slot, mainly for its added boost to Reload Speed. Just remember to do a little jump to ensures you get the best out of it. Finish off with Precision Instrument, which rewards an accurate hand by adding a damage bonus for each shot on target. Be careful, as missing will reset the buff. Maxes out at 25% and keeps rolling until a shot is missed or you need to reload, so this buff can last a sizeable amount of time and take massive chunks off your enemies.
data.name: Blueberries

data.description:
Uncivil Discourse is definitely set up to do well in The Crucible, and with its strong base perks, this god roll enhances it to a competitive level.

Arrowhead Brake is the best choice to narrow the Recoil, help keep shots on target, and we can then add Projection Fuse, which further pushes out the Range, making Uncivil Discourse deadly down longer sight-lines.

Keep Away helps tie everything together as Uncivil Discourse will do its best work at Range and by being away from opponents, its enhancements to Range, Accuracy and Reload Speed make it the top choice in this slot. Finish off with Precision Instrument for how it can easily stack up its damage buff to 25%, rewarding a precise hand in the arena. Balance this with the heat management of these blaster-type weapons, and you could find yourself with a new favourite Hand Cannon.
data.name: Blueberries

data.description:
PvE is where Gizmo Weft shines. Holding the current sandboxes’ most desirable damage perks, there’s so much to unpack with this Grenade Launcher.

Firstly, use Quick Launch and High-Velocity Rounds to help push Velocity to near maximum. This ensures every grenade launches at great speed to meet its target. The god roll we have landed on pulls from quickly filling the Magazine with Envious Arsenal as you cycle through your damage-dealing weapons and the serious damage of Elemental Honing. Dealing damage with both other weapons before returning to Gizmo Weft will ensure the Magazine is refilled and ready for the next blast.

Elemental Honing can reach up to a 35 percent damage increase at 5 stacks, and if you build towards this with Transedent and various elements in your other weapons and abilities, it’s easy to achieve and will pump out solid damage numbers during its 20-second duration.
